EG.evidence:
https://www.washingtoninstitute.org/policy-analysis/growth-chinese-influence-egypt-signs-and-consequences
(China was ranked as the second largest trading partner of Egypt after the United Arab Emirates, while the United States came in third place during the same period.)
https://arabfinance.com/Infographics/Infographicsdetails/335
The most important exporters to Egypt in the first half of this year were China’s exports, which amounted to $5.7 billion.
Meanwhile, the largest supplier from Egypt during the first half of 2023 was Turkey with notable imports of $2.3 billion, totaling $1.6 billion.
https://trendeconomy.com/data/h2/Egypt/TOTAL
Top trading partners (import sources) of Egypt in 2022: China with a share of 14.2% (11.3 billion US$) Saudi Arabia with a share of 8.88% (7.08 billion US$) USA with a share of 7.15% (5.7 billion US$).
Top export destinations of commodities from Egypt in 2022: Turkey with a share of 7.85% (3.78 billion US$). Top trading partners (import sources) of Egypt in 2022: China with a share of 14.2% (11.3 billion US$).
https://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2023/11/07/egypts-foreign-trade-reaches-110-407bn-in-2022-23-cbe/
The Central Bank of Egypt (CBE) reported that the volume of Egypt’s foreign trade during the fiscal year 2022/2023 was about $110.407bn. According to a recent report by the CBE, Egypt’s main trading partners were 14 countries. The report ranked the United Arab Emirates (UAE) as the top trading partner of Egypt during that period. China was the third largest trading partner of Egypt.
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

BY.evidence:
"China’s economic presence in the region has been steadily growing since the late 2000s, with Belarus clearly becoming China’s primary partner. China provided Belarus with an extensive set of economic cooperation tools, including the flagship project of the “Great Stone” Chinese-Belarusian Industrial Park near Minsk, as well as credit lines aimed at developing infrastructure and industry. Belarus has also become a key transit country for rapidly increasing Eurasian railway connections, facilitating 90% of EU-China railway freight trade. (see below URL)

https://cepa.org/the-belarus-china-iron-brotherhood-begins-to-rust/ 

Since 2020, China has been Belarus’s second-largest trading partner after Russia, with the trade balance being strongly negative.

https://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/19851-20221220.pdf

The major trading partners are the Russian Federation, Ukraine, China, Germany, Poland, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Kazakhstan, Turkey and Italy. 

https://president.gov.by/en/belarus/economics/foreign-trade/key-trade-partners"
BY.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

RU.evidence: China has become Russia's main trade partner after a sharp decline in imports from the EU, Kiel analysts reported. According to their calculations, Russia's trade with European countries decreased by 43%, while trade with China increased by 23%.
RU.note: In 2023, after the introduction of several sanctions from the West, including a ban on exporting devices over $200 to Russia, China significantly increased imports of Chinese mobile phones into Russia. These phones are now distributed with pre-installed Russian application stores (RuStore). Chinese manufacturers now occupy 75% of the mobile device market, which is 25% more than a year earlier. It is evident that control over devices imported into the country with pre-installed and government-approved applications allows for increased control and censorship in the Russian online space.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

SV.evidence:
The United States was the main trading partner with El Salvador in 2022. In that year, the trade value of El Salvador with the United States reached almost 7.9 billion U.S. dollars, out of which 2.79 billion dollars accounted for exports. The second most important trading partner for this Central American country was Guatemala, reaching a trade value of roughly 2.9 billion U.S. dollars.
While El Salvador's leading exported goods were knitted apparel items, the country's main imported products included petroleum oils and oils obtained from bituminous minerals.
SV.note: China officially carries out works in El Salvador within the framework of a cooperation agreement for $500 million. The main trading partner of El Salvador is still USA so far. For example, in 2021 USA was the first place of ten countries to which El Salvador sells the most. China was the number ten.
SV.answerer: Answered by Eric Lemus, and has been reviewed by Julio Martinez and Alvaro Cruz

PH.evidence: The Philippine Statistics Authority's Export and Import Statistics as of March 2023 showed that the PRC was the country's top trading partner both in terms of imports and exports. On Sept. 12, Trade Secretary Alfredo Pascual affirmed this in an interview. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TH.evidence:
In terms of economic and trade relations, China is Thailand’s largest trading partner within ASEAN, while Thailand ranks as China’s third largest trading partner.

By 2023, China had also become Thailand's leading partner in cross-border and transit trade, surpassing Malaysia. This shift was largely due to more convenient land routes, which led Thai exports to China transitioning from sea to land transport. Major export products include fresh fruits, rubber, computers, wood, and electronics.

According to Narongsak Puttapornmongkol, president of the Thai Chamber of Commerce, China has held the position of Thailand's No. 1 trading partner for 11 consecutive years.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
